title: How to Make Vegan Green Bean Casserole

steps.headline: Heat a skillet on medium-high heat and add the oil while your oven is preheating to 350°F (176°C).
Sauté the carrots, mushrooms and onion in the skillet for 5 minutes, stirring the mixture frequently.
Season the sautéed vegetables with salt, pepper, herbs and spices as desired.
Whisk together the cornstarch and cold water in a cup.
Heat the soy milk and bouillon in a saucepan, stirring until the cube dissolves.
steps.description: Do not boil or scald the milk.

steps.headline: Add the cornstarch mixture and stir well.
Add the green beans, vegetables and half of the fried onions to the sauce.
Pour the sauce into an oiled casserole dish.
Top it with the remaining fried onions.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until the onions start to brown.

text: Preparing the Vegetables Heat a skillet on medium-high heat and add the oil while your oven is preheating to 350°F (176°C).  Sauté the carrots, mushrooms and onion in the skillet for 5 minutes, stirring the mixture frequently.  Season the sautéed vegetables with salt, pepper, herbs and spices as desired.  Preparing the Sauce Whisk together the cornstarch and cold water in a cup.  Heat the soy milk and bouillon in a saucepan, stirring until the cube dissolves. Do not boil or scald the milk. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir well.  Assembling the Ingredients Add the green beans, vegetables and half of the fried onions to the sauce.  Pour the sauce into an oiled casserole dish.  Top it with the remaining fried onions.  Bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until the onions start to brown.  Finished.
